lexUnit.name: disappointed.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: sad or displeased because one's hopes or expectations have not been fulfilled.

sentence.text: I was disappointed to find that accommodation was scarcer and more expensive than I thought it would be and the best that I could afford was a large first-floor room in a bedsitter house on Ladbroke Grove .
We are disappointed to say the least with the bilateral talks which appear to have got nowhere . "

I 'm disappointed that we can not be represented , but sure you will appreciate position .
I was very disappointed that there 's no comment in here at all .

She was disappointed it was not the one who had kicked in the door .

I remember being disappointed when I woke up next morning to find that the party was over .

I 'm disappointed in you !
I was never more disappointed in anyone .

The fatherly cop is disappointed in me .

I was a bit disappointed in those Laura Ashley dresses , they were to tight for a start .

I was disappointed with my performance .

He should n't be disappointed .
